channel.title: MIS Documentation on MIS documentation
channel.description: Recent content in MIS Documentation on MIS documentation

item.title: Pre-requisites
item.description: You’ll need the following resources before beginning Native Requirements IMS Backend Host Files IMS Frontend Host Files SQL Database Backup Software Requirements Hard Requirements .NET 4.5.2 Framework Standalone Installer SQL Server 2012 Enterprise 32-bit SQL Server Management Studio 2012 32-bit Soft Requirements Google Chrome Browser Standalone (32-bit) Sublime Text Editor Local files available for download Native Requirements IMS-Backend-Host-Files.

item.title: Preparing the Device
item.description: Before doing anything, Install all the pre-requisites properly Please follow the steps, in proper order, for successful installation Open SQL Server Management Studio 2012(may be named as SQL Management Studio) If it didn’t open or, isn’t present, your installation of SQL Server 2012 Enterprise is improper. Re-install SQL Server 2012 Enterprise and select these relevant options Click here to view Step-by-step walkthrough This walkthrough will guide you through the proper installation steps

item.title: Setting Up
item.description: In this segment, we will set up the system to work on a local intranet Before we begin, please ensure that the MIS is properly functioning in the host computer itself. If it is unable, first configure the binding setup in the IIS itself. Or, check if you have failed to follow the previous steps properly. Configuring IIS to our needs Press Win+R and type inetmgr Go to Basic Settings and ensure Application pool is .

item.title: Troubleshoot
item.description: Here are some common issues that you may face while performing this setup SQL backup file refuses to restore into the database Ensure that you are using an instance of SQL Server 2012 while connecting to the database-engine from SQL Server Management Studio. If there are multiple named instances, choosing the incorrect one will create this problem. If all else fails, this can be generally resolved by installing SQL Server 2012.
